alert.note: Alert for Dickey; Emmons; Kidder; La Moure; Logan; McIntosh; Stutsman (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 1:58PM CST until February 22 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST THURSDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM WEDNESDAY TO NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Kidder, Stutsman, Emmons, Logan, LaMoure, McIntosh, and Dickey counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until Midnight CST tonight. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM this evening to Noon CST Thursday. For the Blizzard Warning, from 3 PM Wednesday to Noon CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous travel due to blowing snow reducing visibility. A blizzard will develop Wednesday afternoon, and will continue through Thursday morning, creating dangerous to impossible travel conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills will cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel Wednesday afternoon through Thursday morning should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. Notify a friend or family member of your travel plans. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate winter clothing.

area.areaDesc: Dickey; Emmons; Kidder; La Moure; Logan; McIntosh; Stutsman
